Package org.easylibs.options

Provides command line argument parsing using user defined options.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Accumulator<T>
    Accumultator interface is used to accumulate command line arguments as composite option value.
    BeanInfo
    BeanInfo interface works in conjuction with the Arg annotation and provides access to a class member for setting its value.
    BeanOption
    Bean option that gets its name from a reflected class member's name or if any members are annoted with Arg annotation, the Arg.name() attribute of the annotation.
    Option<T>
    An application defined command line option.
    OptionGroup
    A group of options.
    Options
    Options manager.
    PropertyOption
    Property option that gets its name and maps its value to a java Properties object.
    Registration
    Confirmation that registration or addition succeeded.
    TypeMapper<T>
    The TypeMapper is used to map between command line string arguments and a other java types.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Args
    Main command line argument parser interface.
    Options.Builder
    A builder for options groups.
    TypeRegistry
    A registry for TypeMapper.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ArgException
    A checked base exception class for all exceptions related to parsing of the command line arguments.
    BeanException
    The Class BeanException.
    DuplicateOptionException
    The Class DuplicateOptionException.
    InvalidArgException
    The Class InvalidArgException.
    OptionException
    Unchecked base class exception for all option definition related errors.
    OptionNotFoundException
    The Class OptionNotFoundException.
    TypeMapperNotFoundException
    The Class TypeMapperNotFoundException.
    UnrecognizedArgException
    The Class UnrecognizedArgException.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Arg
    The Arg annotation marks a class field or method as a BeanOptionImpl.

Package org.easylibs.options Description

Provides command line argument parsing using user defined options.

Example - using bean options

public class Example6 {

        /* Collection option */
        @Arg
        private static List<String> filenames;

        @Arg
        private volatile static boolean option2;

        public static void main(String[] ignored) throws OptionException {

                // Supply arguments for example consistancy
                final String[] argv = new String[] {
                                "--filenames=f1,f2,f3,f4,f5",
                                "--",
                                "random string"
                };

                /*
                 * The ofOptional() method only returns the Args parser on success, otherwise it
                 * calls the default error handler and returns an empty value.
                 */
                final Optional<Args> argsOptional = Args.ofOptional(argv, Example6.class);

                if (argsOptional.isPresent()) {
                        final Args args = argsOptional.get();

                        /* Print out the state object fields */
                        System.out.println("-- Example 6 - matched options:");
                        args.getMatchedOptions().forEach(System.out::println);
                        System.out.println();

                        System.out.println("Unmatched options:");
                        args.getUnmatchedOptions().forEach(System.out::println);
                        System.out.println();

                        /* Anything that was unmatched by the parser is stored here */
                        System.out.println("Unmatched args:");
                        args.getUnmatchedArgs().forEach(System.out::println);
                        System.out.println();
                }
        }
}
